translation2: All Bosch electrical tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring instruments are carefully inspected, tested, and subject to strict quality controls by Bosch's quality assurance. Therefore, Bosch provides a warranty for Bosch electrical tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring instruments. The purchaser's claims for defects in the purchase contract with the seller and legal rights are not restricted by this warranty. For these tools, we provide warranty coverage as follows: We provide warranty coverage by repairing defects in the tools free of charge, which are demonstrably caused by material or manufacturing defects within the warranty period. The warranty period is 24 months for tools used privately, and 12 months for tools used commercially or professionally. The warranty period begins from the date of purchase by the first end user. The date on the original purchase receipt is decisive. For all blue electrical tools and measuring instruments purchased for commercial use after September 1, 2004, the warranty period is extended to 36 months if the purchaser registers the tools within 4 weeks of the date of purchase. Battery packs, chargers, and accessories supplied with the tools are excluded from this warranty extension. Registration can only be done online at [www.bosch-pt.com/warranty](http://www.bosch-pt.com/warranty). The registration confirmation and the original purchase receipt, which shows the date of purchase, serve as proof of registration. Registration is only possible if the purchaser agrees to the storage of their data. The following are excluded from the warranty: Parts subject to normal wear and tear or other natural wear and tear, defects in the tool caused by normal wear and tear or other natural use, abnormal environmental conditions, improper operating conditions, overloading, or lack of maintenance or care. Defects in the tool caused by the use of non-Bosch accessories, add-on or replacement parts. Tools on which modifications or additions have been made. Minor deviations from the specified properties that are immaterial to the value and usability of the tool. The repair of the recognized defect is carried out by us at our discretion, either by repairing the defective tool free of charge or by replacing it with a defect-free tool (if necessary also with a successor model). Replaced tools or parts become our property.
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "5", "Explanation": "The text is highly fluent with no grammatical errors or unnatural wording. The syntax is also correct, and the text conveys the company's policies on warranty and quality assurance effectively. " } }

translation2: Tire choice for racing bikes - really that safe from punctures? This morning I woke up full of enthusiasm to prepare for my bike tour next week by at least doing a little training. Said, done, and I rode my racing bike, which I bought yesterday on eBay. The first 40km were also really nice - but then it happened, what lurks in every city (this time: thanks Krefeld!). Glass shards on the route. Zack, loud hissing and my rear tire refused to participate in the rest of the route. Since I couldn't really get a replacement tire and tube on account of the day of the week, I had to turn around again and take the first train back home. Although it wasn't technically that bad, maybe it's better if I practice tire changing again before the bike tour. Now I'm faced with a question and hope that you can help me. Since I have a relatively long route over several days ahead of me, I would rather not have this problem often. Now it wasn't really bad, as the old tires from the previous owner (a very nice old man who had ridden 120km on them until 14:00 on the day I picked up the bike) were still available and he had already described them as suboptimal because he had been riding on them for several years. But if I think about it, I really don't want to have to change a tire after 80-90km of riding. Now I'm talking to an older man at the platform who is surprised that I don't have Marathon Plus tires; these are supposed to be puncture-proof, aren't they? Of course, this all sounds very tempting now. But are they really unbreakable? I don't want to spend 40€/tire now just to be disappointed later. Furthermore, I'm wondering: I think I have 25x622 on my racing bike at the moment. Although this size also seems to be available with the Marathon Plus tires, most of them are already wider. Is this a problem? Or would you recommend other tires for a racing bike in general? The Schwalbe website seems to recommend the Durano DD to me. Thank you in advance for your help and best regards!
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "4", "Explanation": "The text is mostly fluent, with only minor grammatical errors and unnecessary repetitions that do not hinder understanding. Overall, the text flows well and delivers the intended message clearly." } }

translation2: "Party, die wir schmeißen wollten": Frankfurt feiert nach torreichem Comeback gegen Leverkusen Was für eine spektakuläre Reaktion von Eintracht Frankfurt. Nach 22 Minuten befanden sich die zuletzt zweimal in Serie sieglosen Hessen vermeintlich auf dem Weg zur nächsten Bundesliga-Pleite. Doch dann drehte die SGE auf, schoss sich innerhalb von einer guten Stunde den Frust über einen durchwachsenen Saisonstart von der Seele und siegte furios mit 5:2. "Es ist Wahnsinn, was die Jungs heute geleistet haben", jubelte Trainer Oliver Glasner bei DAZN und sprach ein "Pauschal-Lob, an jeden einzelnen, der mit dabei war", aus. Dabei sah es anfangs nach einem erneuten Dämpfer für die nun auf Rang neun nach wie vor hinter ihren Erwartungen stehenden Frankfurter aus. Patrik Schick hatte die Leverkusener mit 2:0 in Führung gebracht. Was dann geschah, beeindruckte auch den SGE-Trainer. "Wie die Spieler dann wieder zurückgekommen sind und eine fantastische Leistung gezeigt haben", so Glasner weiter. Ich bin wahnsinnig happy mit der Leistung, die wir gezeigt haben und natürlich auch mit dem Ergebnis. Auch Abwehrspieler Christopher Lenz, der erstmals seit dem vierten Spieltag und seiner überwundenen Muskelverletzung wieder auf dem Platz stehen konnte, betonte die Moral seiner Teamkollegen. "Ich glaube, unsere Mentalität ist unglaublich groß", sagte der 27-Jährige und freute sich mit einem Blick auf das Ergebnis insbesondere für die Zuschauer. Das war die Party, die wir heute schmeißen wollten. Für die kommenden Aufgaben will Glasner aber nun den Fokus bei sich behalten, sieht sich dafür aber auch hinsichtlich der Personal-Situation gut aufgestellt. Es ist außergewöhnlich, dass wir alle Spieler fit haben im Dezember, dass alle Spieler körperlich in einer Top-Verfassung sind. Es ist Top-Arbeit in unserer medizinischen Abteilung, aber auch die Spieler leben hochprofessionell. Nun wolle man "Schritt für Schritt weitergehen und bescheiden bleiben" und die Aufgaben bis zum Jahreswechsel "auf diesem Niveau durchziehen". Als nächstes steht schon am Mittwoch im Zuge der englischen Woche ein Auswärtsspiel bei Borussia Mönchengladbach (18.30 Uhr, Sky) auf dem Programm.
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "5", "Explanation": "This text is in highly fluent German with no grammatical errors, unnatural wording, or stiff syntax. translation2: Problems with fiber optic + Devolo DLan/Magic  We have had a new fiber optic connection in our house for a few weeks now. Unfortunately, I am now having trouble building a stable WiFi network. Before, I had a DSL 50 Mbit connection and used Devolo DLan, which worked flawlessly and received and transmitted 50 Mbit with only a few exceptions. The new fiber optic connection sends 500 Mbit to the FritzBox 7590 and to the DLan module connected to the FritzBox, but at the other DLan module, which transmits the WiFi, I no longer receive the full 500 Mbit, but the more I move away from the module with my device (e.g. using a socket that is 1, 2, 3, etc. rooms away from the other module), the less I receive (so I use a socket that is 1, 2, 3, etc. rooms away from the other module). This results in the internet with the new fiber optic connection now being slower in the first floor than before (~45 Mbit). I have also ordered a new Devolo Magic set, which apparently uses new technology. This was slightly better than the DLan, but here too there were similar losses. Could someone explain why so much internet speed is lost over the power line with fiber optic? And is LAN really the only solution? It would be extremely time-consuming to lay LAN cables throughout the house. I am really at my wit's end, which is why I created this account. Therefore, I would be all the more grateful for an answer.

translation2: Since its introduction in 2001, the Valvetronix series from VOX has continuously evolved, leading to the combination of advanced modeling technology with the "Valve Reactor" circuit, which perfectly replicates the behavior of a tube amplifier. With the VT20X/VT40X/VT100X amps, we are introducing a brand new modeling engine that is absolutely state-of-the-art in terms of sound quality. Thanks to the VET technology (Virtual Element Technology), which is based on the analysis of components and amp circuits, the VTX amplifiers deliver an authenticity that is absolutely impressive. Of course, these amps also include the multi-stage Valvetronix tube preamplifier, which is based in part on real analog circuits because they simply do a better job of capturing the tonal variations and nuances of a tube amplifier than any simulation. In addition to this sophisticated circuitry, the VTX amplifiers offer a closed housing and a bass reflex system that brings out the natural resonances. With the "Tone Room" software from VOX, you can even correct historical facts on the virtual level until the amp and effects sound the way you've always imagined them. The perfect combination of tube sound with modeling technology is primarily due to the 2001 introduction of the VOX Valve Reactor technology. Of course, it has been refined several times since then to meet new sound requirements, leading to a performance boost for the VOX Valvetronix series in 2010 - with more dynamics and numerous and significantly improved amplifier models. The new VT+ Valvetronix series, from the handy VT20+ to the VT120+ with two speakers, has been designed so that all guitarists seeking maximum sound variety will find what they're looking for. All guitarists dream of the pressure and dynamics of a tube amplifier: they expect a fat sound, a nuanced reproduction of playing dynamics and string attack, and prompt response. During an in-depth analysis, VOX engineers discovered that the power stage determines the tube character of an amplifier and developed the VOX Valve Reactor technology based on this finding. The 12AX7 tube-equipped Valve Reactor circuit of each VT+ amplifier perfectly replicates the behavior, subtle nuances, and sound character of a tube amplifier.

translation2: Federal Minister of Housing, Klara Geywitz: Enteignment does not create new housing The new Federal Minister of Housing, Klara Geywitz (SPD), has spoken out against the expropriation of large housing corporations, as demanded in a Berlin popular vote. "With expropriation, not a single new housing unit is created, it only changes the ownership structure," Geywitz said in an interview with the "Tagesspiegel" (Sunday). My goal is to give tenants security that their rent will remain affordable in the next few years. A colorful mix of private landlords, cooperatives, or housing companies, by the way, is the best protection against monopolization. In Berlin, the coalition of SPD, Greens, and Left Party plans to set up an expert commission to decide how to deal with the outcome of the popular vote. If the situation does not improve, Geywitz ruled out talks with the FDP in the traffic light coalition about further tightening of rental law. The coalition agreement provides for a rent cap until 2029, a limitation of rent increases in tense housing markets, and the expansion of the rent index. I will talk to the Justice Minister to implement this as quickly as possible. If the rental market does not relax anyway, "we will talk with the coalition partners about further steps," emphasized the SPD politician.

translation2: I am fed up with Sky Sport F1 Hello, dear F1 fans, over the course of the season, the quality on German Sky has deteriorated more and more, so I would like to vent a little with this post. First of all, during today's F2 race, the broadcast was interrupted mid-race to start the F1 pre-coverage on time. Although the delayed start and the opening lap accident were far behind schedule, they could still have shown the last (planned) ten minutes and the championship decision (!) Instead, it seems that due to legal reasons, F1 has priority and everything else has to be restricted, so Sky DE had no choice. Nevertheless, it's stupid, especially since Sky UK was able to broadcast the end of the race. Nevertheless, a small praise: commentator Olivier Zwartjes did a good job of accompanying the difficult situation around the heavy accident. Then, in F1, there was again a lack of knowledge about the rules among the commentators Sascha Roos and Ralf Schumacher, as both did not know that you can change tires under a red flag. Although this situation occurred in Imola, Baku, and Silverstone this year, both only came to the conclusion that Verstappen could change tires when there were corresponding radio messages to Hamilton. Both Sky UK and RTL commentators knew immediately that Verstappen had this option. I am of the opinion that such basic rules should simply be known if you commentate on a pay-TV channel's F1. It is also not the first puzzle that is now allowed or required according to the rules, both have constant uncertainties about the rules. Generally, I don't like Roos' artificial commentary style, but I have to admit that taste is subjective. But even Heiko Wasser from RTL is better in my opinion. In addition, there are constant silliness that both simply make unprofessional, such as ordering coffee from (equally clueless) reporter Peter Hardenacke or "UuuuuHD" from Ralf Schumacher. The latter, in particular, brings a lot of chaos into the commentary, which he apparently does not take seriously. Not least, advertising is simply getting out of hand at Sky, in the final lap, Sky is the only broadcaster that goes into advertising, as you can hear on F1TV, the German audio track without commentary has to be used directly after the race. Neither ServusTV nor ORF do this. Also, these two broadcasters make less advertising during training than Sky, and that as a free-to-air broadcaster. Although one must praise Glock and Baumgartner for their work, this alone does not make up for the disadvantages. The rest of Sky Sport F1's program is also very meager and full of repeats. Overall, Sky is really the worst German-language broadcaster that transmits F1. Ironically, RTL does a better job in terms of advertising with the four races they are still allowed to broadcast. Thus, the fantastic F1 season would be much less fun with a reasonable broadcaster than it actually is. I would be interested in your opinion.

translation2: Basketball Bundesliga: Derby disaster for MHP Riesen Ludwigsburg at Merlins Crailsheim At least one youngster, Johannes Patrick, let them down. Again nothing: for the second time in less than three months, the giants lost in Crailsheim - and how! Before the game, Ludwigsburg's coach John Patrick had said looking back on the cup defeat at the beginning of October against the Hakro Merlins Crailsheim: "We still have some anger in our belly". But that didn't calm down after the game, on the contrary, it increased in view of the 61:72 (28:38) defeat in the Basketball Bundesliga. Whereas more than the bare result disappointed the way of appearance. A statistic that expresses the entire dilemma may be cited as an example: the three-point quote was a mere 13 percent, 4 baskets (all from young Johannes Patrick) out of 31 attempts - any questions? The answer came from John Patrick: "We were simply not concentrated enough after the win in Tenerife and did not implement what we trained for." Namely, to move the ball. Quite different reacted his counterpart Sebastian Gleim: "A great game for the second time against Ludwigsburg to win," said the happy coach. "It felt like in front of 10,000 people." Although only 750 visitors were allowed in the Hohenlohe Arena on Saturday, they made up for it. Not least because of BBL top scorer T.J. Shorts, who scored 22 points and led the game for his team. "The best player I've ever trained," Gleim praised him still. While in Patrick's team, the key players like Jordan Hulls (0 points) and Jonah Radebaugh (7) completely failed. Only in the last quarter (22:15) did the giants prevent a complete disaster and came within eight points after they were already 39:59 behind. In addition to Johannes Patrick, Justin Simon scored 12 points. Fortunately, there is not much time for brooding. The giants receive the Skyliners Frankfurt on Wednesday (19:00) and then also in Ludwigsburg in front of a maximum of 750 spectators.

translation2: I find it generally that children should not be forced to take on a parental role for their younger siblings. However, I think it is good for older siblings to take care of their younger siblings to some extent. Looking briefly, helping briefly, bringing the bottle, etc. This way, they learn responsibility, help out in the family, and feel involved. As long as they can still be children themselves, I don't see a problem with that. If your K1 is able to entertain themselves for a short time and it's okay for them, that's fine. You can best judge yourself whether it's suitable for your children. It's not like he has to wrap up K2 and accompany them for hours before bedtime. Legally, it's probably questionable. Perhaps that's why the psychologist's statement comes into play. Because if something were to happen like a fire, break-in, earthquake, alien invasion, etc., it would indeed be too much responsibility for K1 to take care of K2. Whether this is a risk you want to take is, of course, up to you :)

A new 110 kV underground cable will be built in 2022. The approval for the laying of the new high-voltage cable in Tann is legally binding. The government of Lower Bavaria's plan approval decision clears the way for the construction, which is scheduled to begin in 2022. This was announced by the network operator Bayernwerk. The approximately seven-kilometer-long underground cable will connect the transformer station Tann in the north of the municipality and the existing 110 kV line between Simbach and Pfarrkirchen. The cable will be connected near the Edermanning village in Reut to a mast of the overhead line.

translation2: Heavy "Huidlerer" question: Amberg knows the solution  What is a "Huidlerer"? This dialect word, sent in by someone from Amberg, has caused heated thinking in the BR television program "We in Bavaria". But unlike on many previous days, the term remained unmentioned in the "Host mi?" segment. No, it wasn't a "person who is nervous". And neither was it someone "who has to do everything quickly". According to the TV moderator, this was completely wrong. The man from Amberg then provided the solution and thus probably also surprised many people in Upper Palatinate. "The Huidlerer", the viewers learned, "is a cloth with which someone wipes the oven". Dialect researcher Anthony Rowley, who has been asked as an expert by Bavarian Television for years, confirmed this. With the remark that this is a typical Upper Palatinate term, derived somehow from the better-known dialect word "Houdern". Thus, a gap in education was closed - probably also for many who have lived in the Amberg area for a long time.
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "5", "Explanation": "The text is highly fluent in English. It does not contain any grammatical or syntax errors and does not use any unnatural wording. The text is clear, coherent, and easy to understand." } }

translation2: Friedrich achieved his 60th World Cup victory - Nolte wins in the two-man bob - Sport The brand of Norwegian biathlete Ole Einar Björndalen with 94 victories is the goal of the bobsleigh pilot. "I've calculated it, I would have to win about nine and a half races per season to achieve it by Cortina 2026," said the double Olympic champion from BSC Oberbärenburg, who recorded two victories in two days at the races in Winterberg. On Saturday, he fended off Johannes Lochner's attack by five hundredths of a second, moving from third to first place. Then he made some changes to the material setup and on Sunday, he won by 0.30 seconds with a larger lead. With his team Thorsten Margis (SV Halle), Candy Bauer (BSC Oberbärenburg) and Alexander Schüller (SV Halle), he beat Briton Brad Hall. Third place went to Austrian Benjamin Maier. "We took a bigger risk today and were rewarded," said Friedrich, who also recorded his 22nd consecutive victory. Johannes Lochner from Stuttgart, who finished second this time, moved up from fifth place. Christoph Hafer from BC Bad Feilnbach, who finished fourth in the first race, ended up in eighth place after finishing fourth. "If I knew what he was doing differently, I would do it too," said Lochner. Nolte with home win - Podium for Jamanka In the women's event, Laura Nolte achieved her third season victory in the two-man bob on her home track. After only finishing fourth in the monobob the day before, she teamed up with Anschieberin Deborah Levi to win the World Cup on Sunday as part of Germany's triple success. Two-man bob Olympic champion Mariama Jamanka from BRC Thuringia finished second with Germany's fastest sprinter, Alexandra Burghardt from Burghausen. In addition to qualifying for the Olympics, she recorded her first podium finish this winter. The Wiesbadenerin Kim Kalicki finished third with Leonie Fiebig. "It was super cool, my first podium in the World Cup, I'm super happy that Mariama is taking me along. I'm super happy with the development. There's still a lot of potential at the start, but the start times today were okay," said Burghardt and emphasized: "It's not just about pushing, there's a lot to do around it as well". Jamanka was a little annoyed about the less than flawless runs, but said: "It's going in the right direction".
